title: CoinPayCard.net
author: CoinPayCard.net
created_time: January 02, 2023, 04:15:33 PMLast edit: January 02, 2023, 09:32:48 PM by CoinPayCard.net
content: Dear dkbit98,Why do you keep deleting my and other replies to your topic ? You can't take the heat? You opened the discussion, but censoring other users calling you out. One of the deleted posts: Quote from: Bitcoin ForumA reply of yours, quoted below, was deleted by the starter of a self-moderated topic. There are no rules of self-moderation, so this deletion cannot be appealed. Do not continue posting in this topic if the topic-starter has requested that you leave.You can create a new topic if you are unsatisfied with this one. If the topic-starter is scamming, post about it in Scam Accusations.QuoteQuote from: dkbit98 on January 02, 2023, 03:56:58 PMPSIt's very convenient that ''someone'' registered new account iLoveBtt today and his first post was in that revolutionary service topic ... sounds legit:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3526680Again accusing us, we wouldn't be that stupid to create a brand-new account praising ourselves. But as I said before, your ego is so high that you live in your own world. Quote from: Bitcoin ForumA reply of yours, quoted below, was deleted by the starter of a self-moderated topic. There are no rules of self-moderation, so this deletion cannot be appealed. Do not continue posting in this topic if the topic-starter has requested that you leave.You can create a new topic if you are unsatisfied with this one. If the topic-starter is scamming, post about it in Scam Accusations.QuoteWhy are you deleting my replies ?

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: No one is scared here, your post was deleted because you broke one of the OP's rules, more specifically the one about consecutive posting. Next time just edit your last post if you forgot to reply.Quote from: dkbit98 on December 31, 2022, 09:51:57 PMNote that all spam, off-topic, consecutive posting, and all other posts breaking forum rules will be deleted by moderator.

comments.author: CoinPayCard.net
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 02, 2023, 04:23:53 PMNo one is scared here, your post was deleted because you broke one of the OP's rules, more specifically the one about consecutive posting. Next time just edit your last post if you forgot to reply.Quote from: dkbit98 on December 31, 2022, 09:51:57 PMNote that all spam, off-topic, consecutive posting, and all other posts breaking forum rules will be deleted by moderator.So let's be clear, OP accused of us the following:One of the deleted posts: QuoteQuote from: dkbit98 on January 02, 2023, 03:56:58 PMPSIt's very convenient that ''someone'' registered new account iLoveBtt today and his first post was in that revolutionary service topic ... sounds legit:https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3526680We responded with the following: Again accusing us, we wouldn't be that stupid to create a brand-new account praising ourselves. But as I said before, your ego is so high that you live in your own world. And we are spamming or off-topic? His whole conversation in our announcement is off-topic.It shows the brain level on this forum, unfortunately. Also he deleted our reply, only then we posted the other reply with got also deleted. So you point of "consecutive posting" is false

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: CoinPayCard.net on January 02, 2023, 04:28:03 PMOne of the deleted posts: ...As I said, your post was deleted because it was consecutive one (and that is against forum rules as well, see rule nr 33), not because what you wrote. You could have simply edit your last post and include your reply to him instead creating new topic claiming that you are censored. My advice to you is to lock this one and continue discussion dkbit98's topic, this time following rules.Regarding his accusation, it wouldn't be a first time that someone creates an army of sock puppet accounts to shill their business. I am not saying that's the case here, but we've seen it many times before. And yes, people were that stupid.

comments.author: CoinPayCard.net
comments.body: Quote from: Rikafip on January 02, 2023, 04:35:33 PMQuote from: CoinPayCard.net on January 02, 2023, 04:28:03 PMOne of the deleted posts: ...As I said, your post was deleted because it was consecutive one (and that is against forum rules as well, see rule nr 33), not because what you wrote. You could have simply edit your last post and include your reply to him instead creating new topic claiming that you are censored. My advice to you is to lock this one and continue discussion dkbit98's topic, this time following rules.Regarding his accusation, it wouldn't be a first time that services create an army of sock puppet accounts top shill their business. I am not saying that's the case here, but we've seen it many times before. And yes, businesses were that stupid. I know that other users do that, I follow BitcoinTalk for a long time myself. So we would know that it would be very stupid to do so. We are not here to gain any forced trust, but just to announce our service to the users here. BitcoinTalk is absolutely no source of revenue for us, rather a place where ideas and option can be shared. But not this way.And to address your reply again on consecutive posting that is FALSE. We only replied once ( SEE TIME) and that reply got deleted. ONLY AFTER THAT we replied once more in the topic and that reply got also deleted. See the time on the messaged in the second post of mine.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: Quote from: CoinPayCard.net on January 02, 2023, 04:40:29 PMI know that other users do that, I follow BitcoinTalk for a long time myself. So we would know that it would be very stupid to do so. We are not here to gain any forced trust, but just to announce our service to the users here. BitcoinTalk is absolutely no source of revenue for us, rather a place where ideas and option can be shared. But not this way.If you follow this forum for a long time, then you should have be prepared for some tough questions without losing your composure, like you did. Quote from: CoinPayCard.net on January 02, 2023, 04:40:29 PMWe only replied once ( SEE TIME) and that reply got deleted. ONLY AFTER THAT we replied once more in the topic and that reply got also deleted. See the time on the messaged in the second post of mine. As seen in the screenshot below, you made three posts in a row, from which last two were deleted while the first one is still there so I have no idea what are you talking about. And yes, all posts written in that topic are archived, you can see them here https://ninjastic.space/topic/5432564.0

comments.author: decodx
comments.body: Quote from: CoinPayCard.net on January 02, 2023, 04:57:30 PMLet me help you:First, my post was in response to the OP accusing us of creating a new account: I'm not sure if you are intentionally being stupid or if you're just trolling. Do you not understand what consecutive posting means? Let me help you: Consecutive posting refers to the act of posting multiple messages in a row, one after the other, without any other user intervening with a post in between.Rikafip already provided evidence from the archive that clearly shows you published all three of your posts consecutively, without any other user posting in between, following dkbit98's comment. It's a ridiculous waste of time that we have to argue about this, but unfortunately, it's necessary to debunk your false claims.61533255 by dkbit98 on 2023-01-02 15:56:58 UTC61533291 by CoinPayCard.net on 2023-01-02 16:02:21 UTC61533327 by CoinPayCard.net on 2023-01-02 16:10:26 UTC61533337 by CoinPayCard.net on 2023-01-02 16:12:10 UTCreference: https://ninjastic.space/topic/5432564.0
